job_title: Student Library Assistant in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Flexibility with schedule Quiet environment Gain experience on processing books, costumer service, trouble shooting

review_title: Was good, changing but not for the better
pros: Committed to diversity and inclusion, great student community
cons: Very hierarchical (this a change), less input from employees and decision-making done at the administrative level, pays less than other institutions but the costs or working there are higher (particularly parking), moving to a punitive model rather than a nuruting model, moral is on a downward trend

job_title: Director of Career Services in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Team oriented, advancement, diversity, fun colleagues
cons: Don't have any at this time

pros: Great Faculty, Wonderful Support Staff, Diverse Student Population
cons: Enrollment controls the funds available, so that is always an issue at the college and other colleges.

pros: Accessible for city slickers like myself, and they gave me a chance to practice my craft while still in school.
cons: It's student employment so the pay is way below market rate.

pros: Stable, accommodating, flexible, close to classes.
cons: Low number of max hours available.

pros: Good benefits and pay so far
cons: Heavy workload and no work life balance

pros: Many of the faculty and staff go above and beyond to help students succeed
cons: It's OK from a staff perspective

pros: Working with students to help them access higher education – particularly those who did not believe that to be possible - is an exciting and rewarding experience. The organization is incredibly diverse with students and staff of all ages from all over the world coming together in this one beautiful spot downtown. You can’t beat their location on Loring Park within walking distance of the Walker Art Center and everything happening in downtown Minneapolis. There are a number of talented individuals who are attracted to the college because of the mission and the community they serve.
cons: The toxic environment and culture led to a vote of no confidence in the college president and leadership in 2013. Despite numerous climate surveys, consultants and finally even a transition in president in 2014 the environment remains a problem. Power plays, politics and bullying were common and I witnessed three different staff members experience breakdowns due to issues. Much of my work was interrupted, put on hold, and often we had to start over or scrap projects due to employee, administrator or faculty transition. With financial issues, drops in enrollment and continued cuts to programs, employment is less steady and staff layoffs will continue.

review_title: Great job to help a lot  of people personally in their process of entering college.
pros:
Learn many different positions and work with other departments connect to yours. 
Work one on one with students on the phones and in person 
Hours are very flexible, you basically make your own hours. 
Really understanding of times when your sick or late as long as you call and email ahead
Offer you the chance to make up hours
cons:
Not a lot of supervision, so a lot of people slack off and disappear, leave the work to others. 
No place for advancement in this position, have to move to a different area for advancement.

pros: The ability to work independently at a job you love, meet interesting people, and touch people's lives in a very profound way; work with wonderful people and make new friends.
cons: I would have liked the opportunity to work more closely with fellow instructors to exchange ideas and discuss how to deal with certain student issues.

review_title: This college is a place that has honed my skills as a vibrant, creative, and student centered instructor.
pros: Some of the best reasons to work at MCTC are the diverse student body, the location, and the flexibility.
cons: As an adjunct instructor, I have sought the full time status to no avail. I have been there so long, that I wish that my part-time status might be transformed into a full time one.

review_title: Great place to work to help the community and youth
job_title: Human Resources Specialist in Minneapolis, MN
pros: The people!  Everyone cares about helping the students to succeed, and every job in the school has a part in that.
cons: The politics!  Because we are a state agency, our boss changes whenever the Governor changes..

pros: Very flexible schedule. Management make sure to create a schedule that works with your school schedule
cons: Cannot work over 20 hours a week

pros: The pay was great,  and the rom i taught in was vwey good.
cons: Classes I was going to teach would get canceled.

pros: Everyone here is like family. There is nothing they won't do to help you succeed.
Diverse demographic of staff and student population
cons: Constant department head changes for the school.
